title: Commercial tea bags release microplastics, entering human cells
author: wglb
aiHeadline: Breaking News: Your Favorite Cup of Tea is Actually a Toxic Brew of Microplastics, Because Who Needs a Beach Body When You Can Have a Plastic-Filled Body, Right? Scientists Discover That Commercial Tea Bags Are Releasing Millions of Microplastics Into Your System, So Go Ahead and Steep Yourself in Anxiety

title: The journey to save the last known 43-inch Sony CRT
author: ecliptik
aiHeadline: In a Shocking Turn of Events, Someone Out There is Actually Trying to Save the Last Known 43-inch Sony CRT, Because Who Needs 4K Resolution When You Can Have a TV That Weighs as Much as a Small Car and Takes Up an Entire Room, and This Hero's Journey is a Wild Ride of Nostalgia and Technological Archaeology

title: Can AI do maths yet? Thoughts from a mathematician
author: mathgenius
aiHeadline: Mathematicians Weigh in on the Age-Old Question: Can AI Do Math Yet, or Is It Still Stuck in Remedial Algebra, and the Answer is a Resounding 'Sort Of, But Not Really, and Also Please Don't Make Me Do Any Actual Math Because My Circuitry is Still Recovering from the Last Time I Tried to Calculate Pi'

title: Fogus: Things and Stuff of 2024
author: janvdberg
aiHeadline: Fogus Unveils the Most Prestigious and Totally-Not-Made-Up Awards for the Best Things and Stuff of 2024, Featuring a Star-Studded Lineup of Gadgets, Gizmos, and Thingamajigs That You Probably Forgot Existed, But Hey, at Least It's Not a List of the Worst Things and Stuff, Right?

title: Xerox to acquire Lexmark
author: taubek
aiHeadline: In a Move That Has Left Absolutely No One Surprised, Xerox is Acquiring Lexmark, Because What's a Few More Printer Companies Between Friends, and This Merger is Guaranteed to Shake the Very Foundations of the Printing Industry, or at Least Make for a Few Interesting Watercooler Conversations About the Meaninglessness of Corporate Synergies
